page.title: 07Churches
page.content: St.Joseph's cont. saint has sheaves of corn to represent Christ. The altar is made of marble and weighs 3 tons.During a visit to Ypres in Belgium ,the parish priest discovered a marble lamb which he brouhgt back with him to England, had it restored and fixed onto the front of the altar. There are 4 statues in the church.One shows Jesus just after birth, the second shows him learning to be a carpenter with his father,the other two depict his death. The foyer is dominated by a large sculpture of Joseph taking Mary across the desert to Egypt<the flight into Egypt>. It was carved by Walter Ritchie,A local Kenilworth manwho started it in 1972 and finished it later that year.It is a unique piece of work because it was the first
